How to Install mercurial-crecord on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • mercurial-crecord

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install mercurial-crecord on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing mercurial-crecord on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall mercurial-crecord in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install mercurial-crecord, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install mercurial-crecord Using apt

To install mercurial-crecord in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install mercurial-crecord using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install mercurial-crecord

The installation of mercurial-crecord might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install mercurial-crecord Using apt-get

To install mercurial-crecord using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install mercurial-crecord.

sudo apt-get -y install mercurial-crecord

Install mercurial-crecord Using Synaptic

To install mercurial-crecord using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install mercurial-crecord on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for mercurial-crecord. This will display the mercurial-crecord package in the package window, now to install mercurial-crecord, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the mercurial-crecord package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of mercurial-crecord.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install mercurial-crecord Using aptitude

To install mercurial-crecord on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of mercurial-crecord.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install mercurial-crecord using the command aptitude install mercurial-crecord.

sudo aptitude -y install mercurial-crecord

How to Upgrade mercurial-crecord on debian

If you want to upgrade the mercurial-crecord package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade mercurial-crecord using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade mercurial-crecord to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade mercurial-crecord.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade mercurial-crecord sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade mercurial-crecord

Upgrade mercurial-crecord using Aptitude

To upgrade mercurial-crecord using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade mercurial-crecord.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade mercurial-crecord

Upgrade mercurial-crecord using Synaptic

To upgrade mercurial-crecord using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for mercurial-crecord, now right-click mercurial-crecord, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade mercurial-crecord just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall mercurial-crecord on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall mercurial-crecord from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just mercurial-crecord, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove mercurial-crecord

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of mercurial-crecord

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of mercurial-crecord you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge mercurial-crecord

Remove mercurial-crecord using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall mercurial-crecord using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for mercurial-crecord, right-click the mercurial-crecord package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall mercurial-crecord click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install mercurial-crecord on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade mercurial-crecord using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of mercurial-crecord then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
